translations.translation: the strong one who appeared on the uppermost horizon.
And he was on the horizon of the highest heaven.
While he was in the highest part of the horizon,
And he is in the highest part of the horizon.
When he was on the uppermost horizon.
standing poised at the highest point on the horizon,
While he was on the uppermost horizon.
while he was on the highest horizon.
While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
While he [Jibrael (Gabriel)] was in the highest part of the horizon,
while he was in the highest horizon;
While he was at the highest horizon.
While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.

[53:7]   when he was on the highest horizon, the horizon of the sun, that is to say, at the place from which it rises, in the form in which he [Gabriel] was created, so that the Prophet (s) saw him; he [the Prophet] had been at [Mount] Hirā’, where Gabriel had obscured the entire horizon to the west. The Prophet fell down swooning, after he had asked him [Gabriel] to show himself to him in the form in which he was created. Thus Gabriel had made a tryst with him at Hirā’, where he came down to him in human form.
(When he was on the uppermost horizon) at the setting place of the sun; and it is said: at the seventh heaven.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { وَهُوَ بِٱلأُفُقِ ٱلأَعْلَىٰ } معناه بالجَانبِ
 وقال: هو مطلعُ الشَّمسِ الأَعلى

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَهُوَ } حينئذ من كمال التربية والتأييد تمكن { بِٱلأُفُقِ ٱلأَعْلَىٰ } [النجم: 7] الذي هو أفق عالم اللاهوت، ومطلع شمس الذات من مشرق عالم العمى، الذي هو

[النور: 35]

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وهو } أي: جبريل { بالأُفق الأعلى } أفق الشمس، أي: مطلعها، { ثم دنا } جبريلُ من النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم { فتدلَّى } أي: زاد في القرب، أو: استرسل من الأفق مع تعلُّق به
 يقال: تدلت الشجرة، ودلّى رجله من السرير، ودلّى دلوه، والدوالي: الثمر المُعلّق
